column1: A cold beautiful morning for a walk in #JoyceKilmerPark. Lack of wind makes it very comfortable. https://t.co/sbceexomNO

🟦 Require @HUDgov w/ other Fed. agencies to complete consultation on electrical grid funding for #PuertoRico & the #USVI within 30 days.  This is just a start I'll continue fighting to ensure Puerto Rico receives robust assistance to build back stronger & help those in need. https://t.co/AA4xa4gDLh

🟦$2 billion in Community Development Block Grant – Disaster Recovery funds for disaster relief long-term recovery restoration of infrastructure & housing economic revitalization & mitigation in the areas most impacted.

The @AppropsDems has a Puerto Rico Disaster Supplemental ready to go. It would provide:  🟦 $100 million for the educational needs of individuals affected by recent disasters & emergencies  🟦$1.25 billion for repairs to road systems damaged by recent disasters & emergencies
The Trump Administration is more interested in delaying needed repairs than in helping the U.S. citizens living in #PuertoRico. Puerto Rico deserves better: https://t.co/hfGJh1OfgB
This is just another set of roadblocks to recovery aimed to ensure more delay more denial & more ignorance.

It would also provide new oversight authority to the island’s federally mandated Fiscal Control Board which is concerning. It is not clear to me that the fiscal control board or OMB has the ability to increase the authority of that board without action by Congress.

Reported restrictions on Puerto Rico disaster relief funds are outrageous. They would prevent improvements to the resiliency & reliability of the island's electrical grid. Federal contractors would get paid less than $15 an hour despite recent executive order mandating the rate.

Proud to join my friend @RepDarrenSoto in calling on @FEMA to act quickly & do everything in its power to help restore power in #PuertoRico. I also urge @realDonaldTrump once again to issue a major disaster declaration to help expedite their efforts. https://t.co/mr8LNiSbQa

Led letter w/ 56 colleagues urging @realDonaldTrump to issue a major disaster declaration for #PuertoRico. It would facilitate the island's access to critical emergency assistance from the federal government. The administration mustn't abandon them again: https://t.co/DWFesS2HX1

The Trump Administration can’t neglect the island’s needs once again. I am committed to making sure the federal government has learned its past lessons & responds as soon as possible: https://t.co/oh6xnrfUrR

Devastated for #PuertoRico which is going through another natural disaster w/ the earthquake this morning. Many buildings houses & other structures were completely destroyed & at least one person has died. And the island still hasn’t completely recovered from #HurricaneMaria.
Wishing you a Happy and healthy New Year  ————- Felicidades a todos en el nuevo año. https://t.co/juCwn0B0Ny
https://t.co/TMXaCebU3T
https://t.co/U29R7lgO6W

Led @NydiaVelazquez @RepRaulGrijalva & @RepAOC/@AOC in sending a letter to @stevenmnuchin1/@USTreasury calling for greater transparency & oversight of #PuertoRico’s tax breaks for  wealthy individuals & businesses Act 20 & 22. Letter & statement here: https://t.co/YK3zJ6sfpo

For socioeconomic equity we secured:  ✅$440M for @LSCtweets which helps provide legal assistance to underserved communities their highest level ever.  ✅$389.5M for @USEEOC to prevent workplace discrimination.  ✅$333M for @US_EDA for economic development in hard-hit areas. https://t.co/5vEieqKTP6

To address #GunViolence we secured:  ✅ $1.4B for @ATFHQ – an $83 million increase to address gun violence & trafficking.  ✅ $125M for the STOP School Violence Act to help student safety in schools.   ✅ $78.3M for grants to improve @FBI's NICS firearms background check system

To address the #ClimateCrisis:  ✅ $169.5M for @NOAA including $14M to expand supercomputing & cloud computing capacity for climate & weather research  ✅$1.97M for Earth Science @NASA research⬆️ funding for climate science research to better understand our changing planet.
✅ $7.56 billion for the @uscensusbureau to effectively prepare for & conduct a thorough & accurate #2020Census

As Chairman of the @AppropsDems CJS Subcommittee I'm excited to list some of the major funding victories that we were able to secure in the FY 2020 funding package that address issues such as the #ClimateCrisis #2020Census #GunViolence & others:

Don’t miss your chance to #GetCovered for 2020! Open enrollment in #NewYork ends on January 31 2020 but make sure to sign up or renew by December 15 so that your health care coverage starts on January 1 2020: https://t.co/lU4O930QTg

…to help expand access to educational and economic opportunities. This effort will promote economic growth and help @UPR_Oficial continue producing world-class scientific research and innovation talent: https://t.co/Nsb8qf35oJ

Very pleased to see @NASA & @UPR_Oficial team up to expand research opportunities for professors and students in #PuertoRico. As Chairman of the @AppropsDems CJS Subcommittee I've always encouraged @NASA to work closely with different institutions on the island…

Join my office @Vanessalgibson @NYSenatorRivera & @MrMikeBlake tomorrow from 10am to 2pm at the @BronxEOC for a #2020Census Hiring Event. The @uscensusbureau needs people like you who know their community to make sure that all of us #GetCounted in the Bronx. Learn more here: https://t.co/PYV8F8rcZT

This is why I'm proud to support #HR6 the #DreamAndPromise Act of 2019 which passed in the House earlier this year. With the future of the program unclear if you’re a #DACA recipient & your status expires before 2020 you should renew now! #HomeIsHere https://t.co/zJScg9JU3c

They have built their lives here and taking away their legal status will put them back in limbo. In my district there are over 10k #DACA recipients #Dreamers who need permanent protection from deportation.

#SCOTUS should recognize that #HomeIsHere for the 800K #Dreamers. The average #DACA recipient was 6 years old when they arrived in the U.S. and don’t know any other country as home. https://t.co/fbcBswe0U9

“I don’t like for the president of the United States to mention an American citizen for investigation to a foreign leader. I think that is out of bounds.” – Condoleezza Rice former Secretary of State quoted by Reuters [11/11/2019] #DefendOurDemocracy

On this Veterans Day we honor the commitment and sacrifices that all the brave men and women have made to keep this nation safe. In particular let us commemorate those who made the ultimate sacrifice or were wounded. Remembering all of my Army buddies. #Veterans https://t.co/xkacXsdHL6

Thanks @RepVisclosky for putting up w/ my jokes during @AppropsDems mark-ups throughout the years. I look forward to continue working w/ you as we end our time in Congress together. Indiana & our country are losing a true champion for American workers: https://t.co/myJEHCPfCn
Look who was on the same train from Washington D.C. to New York today my dear friend @HillaryClinton. Grateful to have worked so many years on so many issues with you https://t.co/9acyX16eM0
On the first day of early voting in New York I voted.  Have you voted yet? This is something new in our state and we should make use of it. https://t.co/NhhvvEgDMz
Finally early voting comes to New York and I voted on the first day. In addition it’s always an honor to meet constituents and join in a selfie. Have you voted yet? https://t.co/NwKX9doEPt
Starting today you can vote early or on Election Day in New York. This should make it easier to cast your vote. Find your voting site here. https://t.co/YlrkmqIQES https://t.co/dpw8lG5QYx

At @Vanessalgibson’s annual Hispanic Heritage Month Celebration I received the Lifetime Achievement Award. This could not happen without the support of the fine people of the #Bronx for these many years. I want to thank Councilmember Gibson and her Team for this honor. Gracias! https://t.co/2gGpg8cH6Y

It's been over 2 years since #HurricaneMaria & #PuertoRico has yet to receive the entirety of the funds needed to successfully recover because this administration keeps stalling: https://t.co/8qc5iLXCp0

.@HUDgov admitted last week that it purposely failed to comply with the law to delay the delivery of much-needed disaster relief funds for #PuertoRico. We need to know why as well as how this decision was made.

Honored to receive this recognition from @BCCcuny’s #TrioPrograms. From my days as chairman of the education committee in the #NewYorkAssembly and my tenure in congress education has been a priority on my legislative agenda. Thank you!! https://t.co/vB730Ux89K

As Chairman of the @AppropsDems Commerce Justice Science Subcommittee we increased funding by $85 million for programs that help prevent violence & provide support for victims.  #DomesticViolenceAwarenessMonth

Joined @RepEspaillat & others this morning in support of the call by @Brides_March @NMICnyc @dwdcdevelopmen2 & @VIPMujeres to stop #DomesticViolence. W/ over half a million cases unreported every year we must support those who have experienced violence & help raise awareness. https://t.co/QIc8zXKJv7

Today I met with Roberto Yañez President & General Manager of Univision Local Media New York & Bill Tipacti Director of Community Empowerment NY. We discussed many issues including @univisionNY’s #2020Census outreach & community relations. https://t.co/XvxFjfZaOd

Is it appropriate for the President to pressure a foreign country to undermine our elections to help his campaign? It’s a simple question. More Republicans need to answer it. #TruthExposed https://t.co/5OrmmVzilf

Today I testified before @NRDems on the importance of a @latinomuseum to share the countless contributions Latinos have made to our country. With today's historic hearing and a record 219 cosponsors in the House we cannot wait any longer. We need a #LatinoMuseumNow. https://t.co/wOJzfzfGEB
And thank you for your continued support Mr. Chairman. Holding this historic @NRDems hearing is a crucial step in making the @Latinomuseum a reality. https://t.co/Ct6mlLdDJP
Thank you Chair Haaland for having me today and for leading this historic hearing. https://t.co/OVsTIpuamH

As of today we have the most cosponsors on HR.2420 & S.1267 the @latinomuseum Act w/ 219 co-sponsors in the House & 25 in the Senate! Check here to see if your Member of Congress is a co-sponsor:  https://t.co/81CUJlpjM8

Today I join @JoaquinCastrotx civil rights leader @DoloresHuerta & others to testify on the importance of establishing a #LatinoMuseum in our nation's capital. Proud to lead this effort & thankful to @NRDems for holding this hearing here tune in at 10am: https://t.co/M5TkuYhuix

We’ve lost a great American and a great member of Congress. @RepCummings believed in and respected our constitution and our democracy. He was a civil rights leader who believed in our diversity. My colleague and my friend. R.I.P.
Tune in now as I lead the @AppropsDems CJS hearing w/ @NASA Administrator @JimBridenstine about agency efforts to accelerate the next moon mission. Watch here: https://t.co/XRQ4VWCbal
FACT: Ukraine's invitation to visit Washington was contingent on Ukraine President Zelensky investigating a conspiracy theory about the 2016 elections. #TruthExposed https://t.co/RtRPP0pALE

FACT: U.S. diplomats briefed Ukrainian President Zelensky before his call with Trump stressing the most important thing was for "Zelensky to say that he will help investigation." #TruthExposed https://t.co/8zOBeyEqqx

Great start @Yankees. Congrats on the victory. Once again power and pitching. Keep it up   This is only the beginning. So honored to represent New York’s 15th-#Bronx Congressional district home to Yankee Stadium and the #Yankees. https://t.co/20PF7QoVmD

It's been an honor & a pleasure to have served alongside my good friend @NitaLowey throughout the years. Congress is losing a true trailblazer as the first female chair of the @AppropsDems and a fighter for #NewYorkers and for all Americans. https://t.co/eLR64VnwkV

American elections should be decided by Americans. Period. My @HouseGOP colleagues need to decide whether it is ok to pressure foreign governments to undermine American democracy for personal political gain. #TruthExposed
Americans want to see the #TruthExposed. Republicans don’t. So instead they hide behind debunked arguments about the process. https://t.co/jF83oqUN2S

Wonderful recognition from @KarinesReyesNYC at her annual #HHM2019 celebration. Thank you for your kind words. @MarcosCrespo85 @Vpichardo86 @Fernandez4NY @MrMikeBlake @BronxDAClark https://t.co/19ZEZeSkVK

Honored to receive this special recognition from Assembly Member Karines Reyes during her annual #HHM2019 celebration. Great event with community residents and elected officials. @MarcosCrespo85 @Vpichardo86 @MrMikeBlake @BronxDAClark @Fernandez4NY https://t.co/BUZ7UVwg8Z

At 211 House cosponsors and counting our momentum is clear. We are moving closer to creating a #LatinoMuseum to share the stories of countless Latinos who've shaped American history. I thank my colleagues for their support. #HispanicHeritageMonth #OneNationPresente https://t.co/pG2hkVYFoy

My language in the FY 2020 Financial Services Appropriations Committee Report @AppropsDems will help shed light on what impact these tax benefits have on the island’s economy & on federal tax revenues. Read more here: https://t.co/hLzDXLvSf6 https://t.co/grNMArdXkC

#PuertoRico’s debt should not be paid on the backs of hardworking Puerto Ricans who are losing their jobs retirement pensions & homes as a result of the economic crisis all while wealthy corporations & individuals enjoy dubious tax breaks.
Wishing all those who observe a Happy #RoshHashana https://t.co/onTgB8gKeW

As part of today’s #BronxTenMileRace I was honored to receive a special recognition from the @nyrr for my support and participation in running programs in #NYC. Inscription—For his commitment to running forty-six years of elective offices and a lifetime of service. @mcapiraso https://t.co/rpJ4K5GxRR

Hemos perdido uno de los grandes de la canción. Sus interpretaciónes de canciones románticas han sido y seguirán siendo parte de nuestras vidas. Descanse en Paz #PrincipeDeLaCanción https://t.co/6iaSippwRO

The Trump Admin continues to stonewall requests from the Congress for the release of the Inspector General report – despite it being required by law. It’s time to put country before partisanship and #ExposeTheTruth. https://t.co/guox2kEDc2

Had the pleasure of welcoming members of @FoodBank4NYC to discuss food security issues in #TheBronx. I am proud to continue supporting programs that fight hunger in our country because no one should go to bed hungry in this country. https://t.co/D57xsAl7jg

I believe @SpeakerPelosi is taking the right steps forward on impeachment. No one in this country not even the President should be above the law. This is about our democracy rule of law and national security.

Decision by @NYCMayor & @NYCSchools not allowing teachers to join with students in #ClimateChange rallies is a misguided decision. They claim that schools must be free of politics. Since when is saving our planet a political statement? Our city has politicized the issue.

Today we mourn the loss of Puerto Rican trailblazer and former Mayor of Miami Maurice Ferre. First Hispanic Mayor of a major U.S. city “father” of modern-day Miami and great leader well-regarded by people across partisan lines. May he rest in peace. https://t.co/v8lNZmmpQM

Climate change is making natural disasters stronger and more dangerous. It’s also time to act on #ClimateChange and build the resilience of vulnerable areas NOW to protect lives. I stand with the millions of people around the world demanding action. #ClimateStrike

…access to clean water and unexpected power outages are a daily reality. We need solutions for Puerto Rico. I’ve been fighting for fairness and it’s long past time for our federal government to do it’s job and help the island recover. #2YearsAfterMaria

2 years ago today #HurricaneMaria devastated #PuertoRico and the U.S. Virgin Islands. The entire island went dark hundreds of thousands lost their homes and an estimated 3000 people died as a result. Today thousands are still living in roofless homes lack... https://t.co/v5UmrIbzlm

Proud and happy to represent the 15th Congressional district in the Bronx. Home to Yankee Stadium and the Yankees. Congrats on your 100th win and clinching the AL east title. This is only the beginning. @Yankees @RealMichaelKay @News12BX https://t.co/aDb4JyyQhE

Tune in now as I chair the @AppropsDems CJS Subcommittee hearing with @NASA & @NSF to ask them about the implementation of STEM funds.  We are committed to funding the training of our future STEM workforce & to propel scientific research watch here: https://t.co/SUVDkXTIMI

200 days. It’s been more than 200 days since the House passed bipartisan commonsense legislation to expand background checks – a necessary step as we work to #EndGunViolence. And yet @SenateMajLdr McConnell REFUSES to hold a vote!

This #HispanicHeritageMonth I recommit myself to making the Smithsonian American Latino Museum a reality. Proud to lead the bill that would make this happen w/ @HurdOnTheHill. Thanks to the @latinomuseum for their support: https://t.co/JnknYPHhLz https://t.co/8LHN17Iw7A

I stand in solidarity with the nearly 50000 @UAW workers as they bravely exercise their right to strike for better wages benefits and working conditions. American workers deserve a fair share of the growth and prosperity they help create. It's that simple. #UAWStrike https://t.co/m4ZMlc7X8O

More than 3 women are murdered by their partners EVERY DAY in the U.S. #VAWA19 will save lives. Senate Republicans and @senatemajldr must stand with women and pass H.R. 1585 NOW! Survivors deserve nothing less. #VAWA4ALL https://t.co/EFrYB0EudS
Great honor to give opening remarks at @CHCI panel discussion on a path forward for #PuertoRico. #CHCI2019 https://t.co/79i4dyu0UG

It has been 18 years since our nation faced the tragic events of September 11 2001. Today we honor and remember those that we lost and recommit ourselves to #NeverForget. Full statement here: https://t.co/2DxWlswrhG https://t.co/bWPucZQqtp

With less than 8 months to go we'll continue pushing for substantial funding for the @uscensusbureau when Congress is back in session as we've done since day 1. Read our op-ed here: https://t.co/TK6Cqbywji
Joined my NY @AppropsDems colleagues @NitaLowey & @RepGraceMeng in writing an op-ed in the @NYDailyNews  to reaffirm our commitment to an accurate #2020Census.

As a member of the appropriations committee I know that we appropriated those dollars for military construction projects including housing and other essential needs for our troops. Not intended to build a wall. This #Trump money grabbing move is a slap in the face to our troops.
Once again we join voices to ask @senatemajldr Mitch McConnell to pass the commonsense bipartisan anti gun violence legislation stalled in the Senate. This has to stop !!! #DoSomething

Many on the island who lost parts of or their entire residence still lack access to a safe place. Others’ houses are simply not strong or safe enough. For a list of shelters in your town and to learn more about other resources visit: https://t.co/91utKbJeTI

another hurricane could have devastating consequences for thousands of vulnerable families and the local economy. I encourage everyone on the island to be prepared learn more about the local resources available and plan in advance in case the storm turns into a hurricane.
As tropical storm Dorian approaches Puerto Rico we must remain vigilant and stand ready to help the island in any way necessary. Puerto Rico is still recovering from Hurricane Maria and…

Proud to have cosponsored the annual #ConcourseVillage Family Day with @Vanessalgibson @LuisSepulvedaNY @MrMikeBlake.  Happy to be with so many friends and colleagues on this special day. https://t.co/pNVRzWJkxq
Glad to see so many familiar faces enjoying today’s event! https://t.co/YsFr6ysYi4
Thank you to @BronxDAClark for visiting our family day at Concourse Village https://t.co/mu2JsFreDe
Chatting with our senior citizens at Concourse Village for the 2019 annual Family Day @Vanessalgibson @MrMikeBlake @LuisSepulvedaNY https://t.co/V9K0ERgHNJ

In February @HouseDemocrats acted to end gun violence and passed #HR8 and #HR1112. It’s been 175 days and the Senate has done nothing. @SenateMajLdr McConnell won’t even write us back. RT if you think it’s time for McConnell to #DoSomething

My message to my colleagues in the @SenateGOP is simple: #DoSomething. Congress has a duty to prevent gun violence in our communities. For 175 days you have blocked House-passed bills to end gun violence while horrific mass shootings continue. https://t.co/LtTN1nEvDV

ICYMI: @NYGovCuomo put out a call for architects & artists to submit ideas for the creation of a memorial in #NYC to honor the victims & survivors of #HurricaneMaria. Deadline to submit proposals is September 9 2019. Help spread the word! Learn more here: https://t.co/kpUgpI5ZkZ

.@HispanicCaucus and @HouseDemocrats are fighting to #ProtectTheDream - we passed #HR6 the Dream and Promise Act to make sure that the doors of opportunity are open to all who know the US as their home.

For 7 years #DACA has successfully protected 800K young people from deportation. Even as the Trump administration threatens their legal status @HouseDemocrats are fighting to #ProtectTheDream and all #Dreamers must still keep their status up to date→ https://t.co/zJScg9JU3c

Hundreds of thousands of our neighbors colleagues and friends are at risk of losing their legal status in the US. As I fight to #ProtectTheDream in Congress all #DACA recipients must keep their status up to date. Renew yours today → https://t.co/zJScg9JU3c https://t.co/GFUN3vQlXQ

Our government should be fighting to ensure Americans have access to quality affordable health care without facing discrimination based on their pre-existing conditions – not working to take it away from millions! #ProtectOurCare

Millions of Americans live with a pre-existing condition – including 8398900. right here in New York.Thanks to ACA they’re protected from discrimination – but that will go away if Republicans win their anti-health care lawsuit. #ProtectOurCare https://t.co/y0OufxQHpx

Today like so many other days we will send our thoughts and prayers to the victims and families of yet another mass shooting. This time in El Paso. If however we mention guns we are accused of politicizing the issue. Where does it end? Congress has to act. Enough is Enough!!!
It is time for a formal impeachment inquiry.  Read my statement here:  https://t.co/ZJR29cuP24
Happy Dominican Fathers Day. Wishing you all the best always. —-Feliz Día de los Padres Dominicanos. Deseándoles todo lo mejor siempre. https://t.co/D37ilFA1Ce

Great to meet with you and I'm proud to to sponsor the bill.  Now is the time to establish a #latinomuseum and ensure that our history is fully represented! #LatinoHistoryisAmericanHistory https://t.co/oHMp9yXEXn
As the longest serving member of Congress of Puerto Rican descent I will continue to fight on behalf of and stand up for the people of Puerto Rico- as I have done throughout my career.
Recent events will only make things harder at the Federal level going forward but I am confident that together the island can find ways to overcome these challenges.
Now #PuertoRico must come together and chart a path forward as the island continues recovering from the ongoing economic crisis and the effects of hurricane Maria.
Puerto Ricans have spoken and demanded accountability and respect from their leaders.  They have spoken out against mismanagement and corruption issues that have no party lines on the island.

At 10:15 this morning I'll be chairing a CJS @AppropsDems  hearing with the White House Office of Science and Technology Policy @WHOSTP to discuss climate change science and more.  Watch here:    https://t.co/pcTMvBgQeP
@johndesio @meaghan10463 Congratulations-Felicidades. Great news!!!
This week marks #200DaysOfProgress under our new Democratic Majority in the House! Plenty of work left to do but we are making steady progress #ForThePeople! https://t.co/HMOJiq674f
Read my thoughts on recent events in #PuertoRico https://t.co/zGIOFDhRUf

Today@HouseDemocrats took the historic step of passing the #RaisetheWage Act. This bill would gradually raise the minimum wage to $15 by 2025 give 33 MILLION Americans a long overdue raise and lift at least 1.3 MILLION workers out of poverty. https://t.co/yn7DdPzCB9

Great to meet the 2019 CHCI R2L NextGen Participants from the Bronx and Puerto Rico. We discussed how they can affect positive change in their communities. These talented young adults have a great future ahead and can contribute a lot to our communities. @CHCI @HispanicCaucus https://t.co/E4g3bMgeIa

Pleased to meet with students from Universidad Interamericana to talk about how to lobby effectively on behalf of Puerto Rico. Look forward to seeing them again around the halls of Congress soon! https://t.co/cAHgTtPMLO

I just met with @GirlUp advocates from New York to discuss support for the #KeepingGirlsInSchool Act. Millions of girls around the world are not in school. This bill supports women's empowerment and economic security by making sure girls overseas can attend and stay in school. https://t.co/raXy3rIugj
Information on cooling centers in NYC. https://t.co/R4qMb5IFuk

Almost 5 years ago I stood w/ @TheRevAl Eric Garner's family and with his community rallying for justice. I will continue fighting for change to fix a criminal justice system that too often fails our community and people like Eric Garner. https://t.co/xXAryFBtrK

AG Barr’s decision to not file civil rights charges against NYPD officer Daniel Pantaleo for the death of Eric Garner is an injustice to his family & our city. The lack of police accountability in this case makes evident once again how far we still have to go.

In the case of @AOC/@RepAOC if he was referring to her being of Puerto Rican descent it seems like he once again forgot that #PuertoRico is part of the U.S.  We are part of the American family & the President needs to realize that we aren't going anywhere.

Over the weekend President Trump decided to attack four of my colleagues & suggest that they go back to where they came from. This is racism in its purest form a distortion of facts and a disgrace to the office he holds.

Informes indican que las redadas de ICE podrían comenzar el domingo 14 de julio en #NuevaYork y otras ciudades de los EEUU. #ConozcaSusDerechos! Puede encrontrar informacion sobre sus derechos aqui: https://t.co/ir5EkeNtOo y en las imagenes: https://t.co/CMKO02bTEQ

So sad to hear of the passing of Hector Figueroa @figue32bj  a great labor leader and a good friend. His advocacy for workers immigrants women and all those in need of a voice are his legacy. The labor movement and our community have lost a dedicated caring leader. R.I.P.

Glad the President realized it was pointless to continue pushing for a #CitizenshipQuestion in the #2020Census. As Chairman of the @AppropsDems CJS Subcommittee I've been fighting this since day 1 & I'll remain vigilant to ensure a fair & accurate count https://t.co/NJWNIqGEay

More than 130 million Americans live with a pre-existing condition. If Republicans’ Texas v. U.S. lawsuit succeeds they’ll be once again left at the mercy of insurance companies who’ve already proved willing to run up bills for families nationwide. #ProtectOurCare https://t.co/qfyDrMtu07
#SCOTUS has already rejected the Administration’s efforts and printing of the form has already begun without the question. Read my statement here. https://t.co/AXRINAKDsG

The President's ongoing push to include a #CitizenshipQuestion on the #2020Census will cost hundreds of millions of taxpayer $$$. As Chairman of the @AppropsDems Subcommittee overseeing funding for the @uscensusbureau I have no intention of allowing this flagrant waste of money.
https://t.co/qZjCMLRaVS

Puerto Ricans are American. We have to keep repeating this over & over again. Reports coming out of Georgia are disturbing- Puerto Ricans should not have to jump through hoops that other Americans don't have to in order to get a driver’s license: https://t.co/MgeBhNB0Ix

Today is great day for NY. The Commerce Department has finally stopped trying to add a citizenship question to the #2020Census. This is a victory for fairness and accuracy. All people in our communities will be able to respond w/out fear- and New York will benefit #weallcount https://t.co/SlavcCogDD
This disregard for human lives & lack of common decency has no place among law enforcement officials. We should all be outraged: https://t.co/SJkVFgxlaV
The crude & obscene comments of @CBP officers towards migrants & Members of Congress visiting their facilities shows the toxic culture that exists in the agency.
The Serrano Report from last week with information about our work in Congress is available online https://t.co/R8FXf03Iqe

Also important to note that there is language in my @AppropsDems FY 2020 bill approved in the House that prevents funds from being used to include a #CitizenshipQuestion. #WeCount https://t.co/JqHiKnKUxh

The #SCOTUS decision is a victory for those of us who believe in a fair & accurate #2020Census. There is no justification for the #citizenshipquestion and now there is no time to include it.  I expect the @uscensusbureau to print the form without the question. #WeCount

Proud to see the House pass H.R. 3055 which includes my @AppropsDems CJS FY 2020 bill that invests in #justicereform economic development the science agencies programs research focused on #climatechange & addresses #gunviolence. I urge the Senate to pass this bill. https://t.co/T8BWZTNiEm
The Serrano Report with information about our work in The Congress and in The Bronx is available online at: https://t.co/JOHpFi2JOD https://t.co/TwQ7M5FIOZ
